meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for matters relating to Government land.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.text: This Ordinance may be cited as the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means any public officer, or other person, acting on the direction of the Authority given under section 6(2), (2A) or (4A) or 12(2) and any public officer or other person assisting any such public officer or other person; (Amended 56 of 1979 s. 2; E.R. 5 of 2020)

def.name: Contractor
def.leadIn: contractor (承判商), for an excavation or emergency excavation to which an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit relates, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person who enters into a contract, express or implied, with the permittee of the permit to make or maintain all or any part of the excavation for such permittee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who enters into a contract, express or implied, to make or maintain all or any part of an excavation which the person referred to in paragraph (a) has to make or maintain under the contract referred to in paragraph (a); (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)

section.def: emergency excavation (緊急挖掘) means an excavation that is made or maintained consequential upon the occurrence of an emergency incident; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)
emergency excavation permit (緊急挖掘准許證) means an emergency excavation permit issued under section 10C; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)

def.name: EmergencyIncident
def.leadIn: emergency incident (緊急事故) means an incident the occurrence of which reasonably requires an immediate excavation for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prevention of injury to any person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the saving of life of any person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prevention of damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prevention of serious interruption or disruption to any public transport system or utility services; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)

section.def: excavation (挖掘、挖掘工作) means an excavation of land; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)
excavation permit (挖掘准許證) means an excavation permit issued under section 10A; (Replaced 17 of 2003 s. 2)

def.name: LeasedLand
def.leadIn: leased land (已批租土地) means land which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: held under a Government lease; or (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vested in a person by an Ordinance;

section.def: lessee (承租人) means a person holding leased land;
licensing authority (發證當局) means the Authority empowered by section 5 to issue a licence;
nominated permittee (指定持准許證人) means a person regarded as a nominated permittee under section 10G; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)
occupy (佔用) includes use, inhabit, be in possession of, enjoy, erect or maintain a structure on or over, and place or maintain anything on, land;
permittee (持准許證人) means the holder of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)
private street (私家街道) means a street or part of a street on leased land;
Review Board (覆核委員會) means the Review Board constituted under section 10O; (Added 17 of 2003 s. 2)
unleased land (未批租土地) means land which is not leased land;
urban area (市區) means Hong Kong Island, Kowloon and New Kowloon.

subsection.content: Subject to this section, Part III binds the Government so far as it relates to an excavation in unleased land which is a street maintained by the Highways Department.

Part III does not have effect to permit proceedings to be taken against, or to impose any criminal liability on, the Government or a person doing anything in the course of carrying out his duties as a public officer in the service of the Government.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority considers that a public officer, in carrying out his duties in the service of the Government, has done an act or made an omission in contravention of Part III, the Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the matter to the Secretary for Development; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the report, advise him, that the act or omission has, as the case may be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: been terminated to the Authority’s satisfaction; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not been terminated to the Authority’s satisfaction.

subsection.content: On receiving a report under subsection (3) where paragraph (b)(ii) of that subsection is applicable, the Secretary for Development shall investigate the matter to which the report relates and ascertain if the public officer concerned is continuing to contravene Part III or has stopped the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: If an investigation under subsection (4) shows that the public officer concerned is continuing to contravene Part III, the Secretary for Development shall ensure that the best practicable steps are taken to— (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stop the contravention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: avoid the recurrence of any like contravention if he considers that the public officer concerned or any other public officer, is likely to commit the like contravention.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a report under subsection (3) is received where paragraph (b)(i) of that subsection is applicable; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an investigation under subsection (4) shows that the public officer concerned has stopped the contravention; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Development considers that the public officer concerned or any other public officer, is likely to commit a like contravention,

subsection.continued: then the Secretary for Development shall ensure that the best practicable steps are taken to avoid the recurrence of the like contravention.

subsection.content: For the purpose of the provisions of this Ordinance specified in the first column of the Schedule the Authority shall, in the areas specified in the second column of that Schedule, be the person or public officer specified in respect thereof in the third column of that Schedule. (Amended 23 of 1973 s. 36)
The Chief Executive may by notice in the Gazette amend the Schedule. (Amended 3 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Occupation of unleased land
section.content: Unleased land shall not be occupied except under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation.

subsection.content: The Authority may, on payment of the appropriate prescribed fee, issue a licence to occupy unleased land.
Subject to subsection (3), a licence shall be valid for the period specified therein and may be renewed for such period as the licensing authority thinks fit.
A licence may be terminated by the licensing authority by giving such notice as may be specified in the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2A), if unleased land is occupied, otherwise than under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation, the Authority may cause a notice, requiring the occupation of the land to cease before such date as may be specified in the notice, to be posted in one or more places— (Amended 56 of 1979 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on or near the land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any property or structure on the land.

subsection.leadIn: If the occupation of unleased land does not cease as required by a notice under subsection (1), any public officer, or other person, acting on the direction of the Authority may, with the assistance of such other public officers or other persons as may be necessary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove from the land the persons (if any) thereon; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take possession of any property or structure on the land.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a structure is being erected on or over unleased land, otherwise than under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a structure has been erected on unleased land, otherwise than under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation, and the Authority is reasonably satisfied that the structure is not being habitually and bona fide used,

subsection.continued: any public officer, or other person, acting on the direction of the Authority may, with the assistance of such other public officers or other persons as may be necessary, and without giving any notice—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: remove from the structure any person or property therein;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: demolish the structure; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: take possession of such property and of any property resulting from the demolition of the structure. (Added 56 of 1979 s. 3)

subsection.content: Any property or structure of which possession is taken under subsection (2)(b) or (2A)(iii) shall become the property of the Government free from the rights of any person and may be demolished or otherwise dealt with as the Authority thinks fit. (Amended 56 of 1979 s. 3; 29 of 1998 s. 105; E.R. 5 of 2020)

Any person occupying unleased land, otherwise than under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation, who without reasonable excuse does not cease to occupy the same as required by a notice under subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence. (Amended 3 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.name: 4AA
subsection.leadIn: A person who is guilty of an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $50,000 for each day during which the offence continues; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for each day during which the offence continues. (Added 3 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is engaged in any way in the erection of a structure on unleased land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: arranges or directs the erection of a structure on unleased land,

subsection.continued: being a structure being erected otherwise than under a licence or a deed or memorandum of appropriation, shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 56 of 1979 s. 3. Amended 46 of 1982 s. 2; 3 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: A person who is guilty of an offence under subsection (4A) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: if the contravening act is done for the purpose of disposing of the structure for the gain of the person or another (gainful purpose)—to a fine of $2,500,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the contravening act is done for any other purpose—to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the contravening act is done for a gainful purpose—to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the contravening act is done for any other purpose—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 3 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.content: The Authority may recover from any person convicted of an offence under subsection (4) or (4A) any cost incurred in or arising out of the demolition of any property or structure under subsection (2A) or (3) and the exercise of the powers conferred by this section. (Amended 56 of 1979 s. 3)

In any court proceedings for an offence under subsection (4) or (4A), the court may, on application by the Authority or on the court’s own initiative, order the person convicted of the offence to pay the cost mentioned in subsection (5). (Added 3 of 2015 s. 3)

The cost mentioned in subsection (5) may be recovered from or ordered against a person in addition to any penalty imposed on the person under subsections (4AA) and (4B) for the offence. (Added 3 of 2015 s. 3)
Subsections (1), (2) and (3) have effect subject to section 110 of the Private Columbaria Ordinance (Cap. 630). (Added 8 of 2017 s. 115 and E.R. 4 of 2017)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Presumption
section.content: In any proceedings for an offence under paragraph (a) or (b) of section 6(4A) in respect of any structure, any person who is proved to have done any act specified in paragraph (a) or (b) of that section shall, until the contrary is proved, be presumed to have done so for the purpose of disposing of that structure for gain.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition of removal of earth, turf or stone from unleased land

subsection.content: No person shall extract or remove earth, turf or stone from unleased land except under and in accordance with a removal permit issued under this section.
The Authority may issue a removal permit authorizing the extraction and removal of earth, turf or stone from unleased land.
A removal permit shall be valid for the period specified therein, but the Authority may extend the period for which the permit is valid.
Any person who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 3 of 2015 s. 4)

editorialNote.content: This Part was amended by section 4 of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2003 (17 of 2003). For the transitional provisions, see section 10 of 17 of 2003.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of this Part and the Schedule—
subsection.def: initial period (首段期間) means the initial period mentioned in section 10C(3);
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Development; (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
street (街道) includes any slope not used or frequented by the public or to which the public do not have access or are not permitted to have access;
street maintained by the Highways Department (由路政署維修的街道) includes any road defined under section 2 of the Tramway Ordinance (Cap. 107) which is not reserved exclusively for use by trams.

subsection.content: Any reference in this Part or the Schedule to a street (街道) shall be construed as a street in unleased land and maintained by the Highways Department. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)
Sections 10C, 10D, 10E(2), 10F, 10L, 10M, 10N, 10O, 10P, 10U, 18B and 18C only apply in the case of an excavation in a street.
Sections 10B and 10R only apply in the case of an excavation in unleased land, other than streets.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Control of excavations in unleased land

subsection.leadIn: Except under and in accordance with a prospecting licence, mining licence or sand removal permit, or a lease, licence, deed of appropriation, memorandum of appropriation or engineering conditions for land allocation, issued by the Director of Lands, a person shall not make or maintain any excavation in unleased land unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he is the holder of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he is the contractor of the holder of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he so makes or maintains the excavation under and in accordance with the permit.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a person who contravenes subsection (1) by making or maintaining an excavation in unleased land without being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holder of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contractor of the holder of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (6), a person who contravenes subsection (1) by making or maintaining an excavation in unleased land in contravention of any condition of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person, other than a permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit, makes or maintains an excavation or emergency excavation to which the permit relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a breach of any condition of the permit as a result of any conduct of the person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is no nominated permittee in relation to the permit at the time of the breach of the condition,

subsection.continued: the permittee shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person, other than a permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit, makes or maintains an excavation or emergency excavation to which the permit relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a breach of any condition of the permit as a result of any conduct of the person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is a nominated permittee in relation to the permit at the time of the breach of the condition,

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the condition is under the permit to be complied with by the permittee, the permittee shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where the condition is under the permit to be complied with by the nominated permittee, the nominated permittee shall, unless he is already guilty of an offence under subsection (3), be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: where the condition is under the permit to be complied with by both the permittee and the nominated permittee, then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the permittee, unless he is already guilty of an offence under subsection (3); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nominated permittee, unless he is already guilty of an offence under subsection (3),

paragraph.continued: shall each be guilty of an offence and shall each be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a defence for a person, other than a nominated permittee, charged with an offence under subsection (2) or (3) to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he was making or maintaining the excavation in question under the direction of another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he believed on reasonable grounds that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that other person was authorized under an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit to make and maintain the excavation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he was authorized by virtue of the permit to make and maintain the excavation.

subsection.content: It shall be a defence for a permittee or nominated permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit charged with an offence under subsection (4) or (5) to show that the person referred to in subsection (4)(a) or (5)(a) (as the case may be) was not authorized by him to make or maintain the excavation or emergency excavation to which the permit relates.

subsection.leadIn: If any person makes or maintains an excavation in unleased land, without an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit, the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: carry out such works as he considers necessary to reinstate and make good—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the unleased land; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other land the reinstatement and making good of which is in his opinion necessary in consequence of the excavation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recover the cost of any work carried out by him under this subsection from the person.

subsection.content: The Authority may, on payment of the appropriate prescribed fee and subject to such conditions as he thinks fit, issue an excavation permit, authorizing the making and maintaining of excavations in unleased land.
An excavation permit shall be valid for the period specified therein as that for which it is valid unless it is terminated under section 10K.
The Authority may, on payment of the appropriate prescribed fee, extend the period for which an excavation permit is valid.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority issued an excavation permit for an excavation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the permittee of the permit is unable to have access to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a reasonably substantial portion of the street concerned for the purpose of making or maintaining the excavation, after the commencement of the period for which the permit is valid but before the commencement of the excavation, for reason other than the fault of the permittee, the contractor for the excavation or their employees; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a reasonably substantial portion of the land concerned, other than a street, for the purpose of making or maintaining the excavation, after the commencement of the period for which the permit is valid, for reason other than the fault of the permittee, the contractor for the excavation or their employees,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, without payment of any prescribed fee or any part thereof (other than that paid under subsections (1) and (3)), extend that period by the number of days for which the permittee is so unable to have access to the land.

subsection.content: Subject to section 10L, any prescribed fee paid under subsection (1) is not refundable.

Any person who intends to make and maintain an excavation in unleased land may apply to the Authority in writing to exempt the excavation from complying with all or any provision of this Part and shall set out the reasons for the application.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of an application made under subsection (1), the Authority may by notice in writing exempt the excavation referred to in the application from all or any provision of this Part if the Authority is of the opinion that the excavation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is minor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will not involve or is unlikely to involve lateral support or substantial work in terms of the extent, duration and size of the excavation and the area that will be or is likely to be affected by the excavation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: will not cause or is unlikely to cause any inconvenience or danger to the public;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: will not cause or is unlikely to cause any delay to traffic; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: will not pose or is unlikely to pose a danger to any underground apparatus or properties.

subsection.content: The Authority may, subject to such conditions as he thinks fit, issue an emergency excavation permit, authorizing the making and maintaining of emergency excavations.
An emergency excavation permit shall be valid for 6 months unless it is terminated under section 10K.

During the period for which an emergency excavation permit is valid, the permittee of the permit may, subject to the conditions specified in the permit, make and maintain an emergency excavation for each emergency incident during a period (initial period) of 7 days from the date of the report of the incident to the Authority.

The Authority may require a permittee to pay the appropriate prescribed fee for an emergency excavation made or maintained during the initial period either before or after the expiration of the initial period.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculation of the appropriate prescribed fee, the duration of an emergency excavation which can be completed within the initial period shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of days commencing from the date of the report of the emergency incident to the Authority and expiring on the date of the report of the completion of the excavation to the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 7 days if there is no report of the completion of the excavation to the Authority.

subsection.content: Subject to section 10L, any prescribed fee paid under subsection (4) is not refundable.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority issued an emergency excavation permit for an excavation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the permittee of the permit is unable to have access to a reasonably substantial portion of the land concerned for the purpose of making or maintaining the excavation, after the date of the report of the emergency incident concerned to the Authority under subsection (3) but before the commencement of the excavation, for reason other than the fault of the permittee, the contractor for the excavation or their employees,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, without payment of any prescribed fee or any part thereof (other than that required to be paid under subsection (4)), extend the initial period by the number of days for which the permittee is so unable to have access to the land.

section.name: s10D
section.heading: Emergency excavation which lasts for more than 7 days

subsection.content: If the permittee of an emergency excavation permit anticipates that he has to make or maintain an emergency excavation for more than 7 days, the permittee shall apply to the Authority for the issue of an excavation permit before the expiry of the initial period of the excavation.

subsection.leadIn: Upon receipt of an application mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an excavation permit is deemed to be issued to the permittee of an emergency excavation permit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the same terms and conditions as an emergency excavation permit; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: commencing from the date of the commencement of the emergency incident to which an emergency excavation permit relates and expiring on the date of the notification of the result of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the initial period under an emergency excavation permit is deemed to be extinguished.

subsection.content: The Authority shall determine the period for which an excavation permit deemed to be issued under subsection (2)(a) shall be valid and may revise the expiry date of the permit to a date which is later than the original expiry date.

If the period determined by the Authority under subsection (3) is shorter than the period applied for by the permittee under subsection (1), the Authority may, in respect of an excavation permit deemed to be issued under subsection (2)(a), grant an extension for a period commencing from a date next following the expiry of the permit and expiring on the last day of the period applied for by the permittee.
The Authority may require a permittee to pay the appropriate prescribed fee for an excavation permit deemed to be issued and an extension granted under this section.

section.name: s10E
section.heading: Refusal of issue of excavation permit

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may refuse to issue an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he reasonably believes that the person making the application for the issue of the permit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is not a fit and proper person to make or maintain any excavation in unleased land;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cannot comply with the conditions imposed under the permit; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: does not have sufficient financial resources to make or maintain an excavation to which the permit relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the opinion of the Authority, the application to which the permit relates is unreasonable; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having regard to the circumstances of the case, the issue of the permit is, in the opinion of the Authority, inappropriate in such circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to the grounds specified in subsection (1), the Authority may, on reasonable grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: refuse to issue an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person who makes the application for the issue of the permit fails to submit the application within the time limit specified by the Authority under section 18C; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the street to which the permit relates is a newly constructed street specified by the Authority under section 18C;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to extend the period for which an excavation permit is valid if the person who makes the application for the extension fails to submit the application within the time limit specified by the Authority under section 18C.

subsection.content: Where the Authority refuses to issue a permit or extend the period for which a permit is valid, he shall notify the person who made the application in writing of the grounds for such refusal.

section.name: s10F
section.heading: Late application for extension of excavation permit

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 10E(2), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a permittee applies for an extension of the validity period of an excavation permit beyond the time limit specified for such excavation under section 18C but before the expiry date of the permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is accompanied by the appropriate prescribed fee based on the duration of the period applied for by the permittee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority has not made his decision on the application on or before the expiry date of the permit,

subsection.continued: the permit shall, unless sooner terminated under this Ordinance and subject to subsection (2), be deemed to be extended up to the expiry of the period applied for by the permittee.

subsection.content: The Authority shall determine the period for which an excavation permit deemed to be extended under subsection (1) shall be valid and may revise the expiry date of the permit to a date which is earlier than the expiry date in subsection (1).
The Authority shall serve a notice of his determination under subsection (2) on the permittee concerned.

If the period determined by the Authority under subsection (2) is shorter than the period applied for by the permittee concerned, he shall refund any extra prescribed fee to the permittee without interest.

section.name: s10G
section.heading: Nominated permittee
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a contractor is regarded as a nominated permittee in relation to an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is nominated by a permittee of the permit as a nominated permittee under section 10H;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he consents to the nomination and agrees to comply with the conditions in the permit under section 10I; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority approves the nomination under section 10J.

subsection.content: A contractor shall not be regarded as being nominated as a nominated permittee in relation to an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit unless the permittee of the permit has sent to the Authority a notice in writing nominating that contractor as the nominated permittee of the permit.

A permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit may withdraw the nomination of a contractor under subsection (1) by sending a notice of withdrawal to the Authority and the contractor.
A notice of withdrawal referred to in subsection (2) takes effect on the date of the receipt of the notice by the Authority or such later date as is specified in the notice.

section.name: s10I
section.heading: Consent and agreement by nominated permittee

subsection.content: A contractor shall not be regarded as giving the consent and agreement referred to in section 10G(b) as a nominated permittee in relation to an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit unless that contractor has sent to the Authority a notice in writing to that effect.

A nominated permittee in relation to an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit may withdraw his consent and agreement referred to in subsection (1) by sending a notice of withdrawal to the Authority and the permittee of the permit.
A notice of withdrawal referred to in subsection (2) takes effect on the date of the receipt of the notice by the Authority or such later date as is specified in the notice.
The Authority may approve the nomination of a contractor as a nominated permittee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may withdraw his approval under subsection (1) to the nomination of a contractor as a nominated permittee in relation to an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Authority is satisfied that the nominated permittee is incapable of complying with any of the conditions which under the permit are to be complied with by the nominated permittee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending a notice of withdrawal to the permittee of the permit and the nominated permittee.

subsection.content: A notice of withdrawal referred to in subsection (2) takes effect on the date specified in the notice.

section.name: s10K
section.heading: Termination of excavation permit or emergency excavation permit

subsection.leadIn: If there is a breach of any condition of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit, the Authority may terminate the permit by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serving a notice of the termination to the permittee of the permit and the nominated permittee (if any) in relation to the permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: posting a notice of the termination at a conspicuous place on the unleased land to which the permit relates.

subsection.content: An excavation permit or emergency excavation permit is regarded as terminated from the date of the posting of the notice of the termination relating to it under subsection (1)(b).

For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that there shall be no refund of any prescribed fee paid under section 10A(1) or (3), 10C(4) or 10D(5) in respect of or in connection with an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit which is terminated under this section. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Where an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit is terminated, the termination does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power of the Authority to require a permittee of the permit to pay the appropriate prescribed fee under section 10C(4) or 10D(5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the obligation of the permittee to pay the appropriate prescribed fee as required by the Authority under that section.

section.name: s10L
section.heading: Refund of daily fee and economic costs paid for extension of excavation permit

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may refund the whole or any part of the economic costs paid for an extension of an excavation permit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the permittee of the permit makes an application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a refund of the economic costs within one month from the date of the notification of the result of the application for an extension of the excavation permit; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: stating the reasons and setting out the evidence in support of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that the extension is caused by reasons other than the fault of a permittee of the permit, its contractors and employees, including but not limited to the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: inclement weather which includes the hoisting at the Hong Kong Observatory of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the No. 3 visual storm warning or above;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: rainstorm warning;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: suspension of excavation on order of the Government which is not due to the fault of the permittee, its contractors or employees;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: physical condition of the unleased land to which the permit relates and which is not in existence at the time of the application of the permit; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the reasons mentioned in paragraph (b) hindered the progress of an excavation to which the permit relates.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permittee of an excavation permit completes an excavation to which the permit relates before the expiry date of the permit or the extended period of the permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the permittee notifies the Authority of the completion of the excavation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the permittee has reinstated the land to which the permit relates as required by the conditions of the permit,

subsection.continued: the Authority may refund a sum which is equivalent to the daily fee and economic costs (if any) paid in respect of the period commencing from the date next following the date of notification of the completion of the excavation and expiring on the expiry date of the permit or the extended period of the permit, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Any refund of daily fee or economic costs under this section shall be paid by the Authority without interest.

subsection.def: In this section, rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) means a warning issued by the Director of the Hong Kong Observatory of a heavy rainstorm in, or in the vicinity of, Hong Kong by the use of the heavy rainstorm signal commonly referred to as Amber, Red or Black.

subsection.leadIn: A public officer of the rank of Chief Technical Officer, Engineer or Senior Engineer or a public officer of equivalent rank with engineering qualifications relevant to the excavation concerned (collectively referred to as the Engineer) in the Highways Department acting as the delegate of the Director of Highways shall make an assessment on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the duration of an excavation permit if he exercises the Director of Highways’ power under section 10A(1);

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
f
g
h
i
paragraph.content: whether a permittee has satisfied the matters in section 10L(2)(a), (b) and (c) if he exercises the Director of Highways’ power under section 10L(2).

subsection.content: The Engineer who made an assessment under subsection (1) shall serve a notice of the result of his assessment on the permittee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A permittee who is aggrieved by an assessment made in respect of him under subsection (1) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 28 days from the date of service of the notice under subsection (2), apply in writing to a public officer of the rank of Chief Engineer or Government Engineer or a public officer of equivalent rank with engineering qualifications relevant to the excavation concerned (collectively referred to as the Chief Engineer) in the Highways Department for a review of the Engineer’s assessment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the result of his own assessment in an application made under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under subsection (3), the Chief Engineer shall review the assessment of the Engineer and serve a notice of the result of his review on the permittee concerned within 28 days from the date of the receipt of the application for review.

subsection.leadIn: On a review under subsection (4), the Chief Engineer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary the assessment complained of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a permittee who applied for a review under subsection (3) to pay extra prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refund the prescribed fee or any part of the prescribed fee paid by the permittee.

subsection.leadIn: After receipt of an application under subsection (3), if the Chief Engineer fails to serve a notice of the result of his review on the permittee concerned within the time specified in subsection (4), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where subsection (3)(b) is applicable, the result of the permittee’s assessment shall be taken to be the result of the Chief Engineer’s review; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the assessment made by the Engineer under subsection (1) on the subject matter of the application shall be taken to be the result of the Chief Engineer’s review,

subsection.continued: and the Chief Engineer may, in accordance with the result of the review, exercise any of the powers conferred on him under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: A permittee who is aggrieved by a decision made in respect of him under subsection (5) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 28 days from the date of service of the notice under subsection (4), apply in writing to the Director of Highways for a review of the Chief Engineer’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the result of his own assessment in an application made under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: On receipt of an application under subsection (7), the Director of Highways shall notify the Secretary who will set up a Review Board in accordance with section 10O.

The Review Board may fix a time and place for hearing an application for review under subsection (7) and invite the permittee concerned and the Chief Engineer who made the decision complained of to present their case.
A permittee who is invited to appear before a Review Board under subsection (9) may appear in person or may be represented by his authorized representative.
The Director of Highways shall serve a notice of the Review Board’s decision on the permittee concerned within 14 days from the date of the decision of the Review Board.
The Director of Highways shall appoint a public officer to be the secretary of the Review Board and the officer shall keep a record of every meeting of the Review Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Review Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary the decision complained of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a permittee who applied for a review under subsection (7) to pay extra prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refund any prescribed fee or any part of the prescribed fee paid by the permittee.

subsection.leadIn: After receipt of an application under subsection (7), if the Director of Highways fails to serve a notice of the Review Board’s decision on the applicant within the time specified in subsection (11), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where subsection (7)(b) is applicable, the result of the permittee’s assessment shall be taken to be the decision of the Review Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the decision made by the Chief Engineer under subsection (5) on the subject matter of the application shall be taken to be the decision of the Review Board,

subsection.continued: and the Review Board may, in accordance with the decision, exercise any of the powers conferred on it under subsection (13).

subsection.leadIn: Except a decision relating to an assessment made under subsection (1)(d), (g), (h) or (i), the following decision shall be final—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any decision made under subsection (13); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any decision taken to be the decision of the Review Board under subsection (14).

subsection.content: An application for a review of an assessment or decision made under this section does not affect the obligation of a permittee to pay the appropriate prescribed fee as required by the Authority under this Part.
Any payment of extra prescribed fees and refund of prescribed fees or any part thereof under this section shall be paid by a permittee or the Authority, as the case may require, without interest.

The Secretary may appoint a panel of not more than 20 persons (the Review Panel) whom he considers suitable to sit as members of a Review Board to review the Chief Engineer’s decision under section 10M(5).
The Secretary shall not appoint any public officer to the Review Panel.

subsection.leadIn: A person appointed under subsection (1) shall hold office for a period of 3 years and may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be reappointed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: resign by notice in writing served on the Secretary.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (1) shall not hold office for more than 6 consecutive years.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of a notification under section 10M(8), the Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compile a list of the names of members whom he intends to appoint to constitute the Review Board to review the Chief Engineer’s decision under section 10M(5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a notice on the members mentioned in paragraph (a) requiring them to make a declaration as to whether they have or do not have any direct or indirect interest in the review concerned within 7 days from the date of service of the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: serve a notice on the permittee concerned notifying him the names of the members mentioned in paragraph (a) and his right to raise any objection on the appointment of any member on the ground that the member has direct or indirect interest in the review within 7 days from the date of service of the notice.

subsection.content: The objection in subsection (1)(c) shall be in writing and shall be accompanied by all written statements and other documentary evidence relied upon by the permittee concerned in support of the objection.

After the expiry of the period allowed for the declaration of interest and the raising of objection under subsection (1)(b) and (c), the Secretary shall, subject to subsections (5) and (6), finalize the composition of the Review Board by appointing 3 or 5 persons (excluding the Chairman) from the list compiled under subsection (1) to constitute the Review Board after taking into consideration the declaration of interest of the members and the objection raised by the permittee concerned.
The Director of Highways shall be the Chairman of the Review Board.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of subsection (3), the Secretary shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least one public officer of the rank of Government Engineer or above or a public officer of equivalent rank with engineering qualifications relevant to the excavation concerned from the Highways Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one member from the Review Panel; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 or 3 other persons as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: The majority of the persons constituting a Review Board, excluding the Chairman, shall be persons other than public officers.

If at any time during the review proceedings, it is discovered that any member of the Review Board has a direct or indirect interest in the review concerned, the Chairman may adjourn the proceedings and inform the Secretary.
The Secretary shall terminate the appointment of the member and appoint another member by applying the procedures in subsections (1), (2) and (3) with necessary modification as he thinks fit.
After the appointment of a new member under subsection (8), the Review Board may rehear the application wholly or in part if it is satisfied that it is just to do so.

The Review Board shall not proceed to hear an application for a review of the Chief Engineer’s decision under section 10M(5) at a hearing other than to adjourn unless all the members appointed under section 10O(3) are present.
All the matters for determination at a hearing of the Review Board shall be decided by a majority of vote of the members present.
The Chairman shall not vote at the hearing of the Review Board.
In case there is an equality of votes, the Chairman shall discharge the Review Board and notify the Secretary.

On receipt of the notification under subsection (4), the Secretary shall apply the procedures in section 10O(1), (2) and (3) with necessary modification to appoint another Review Board to hear the review concerned.

subsection.leadIn: In case there is an equality of votes at a hearing of the Review Board appointed under subsection (5), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where section 10M(7)(b) is applicable, the result of the permittee’s assessment shall be taken to be the decision of the Review Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the decision made by the Chief Engineer under section 10M(5) on the subject matter of the application shall be taken to be the decision of the Review Board,

subsection.continued: and the Review Board may, in accordance with the decision, exercise any of the powers conferred on it under section 10M(13).

section.name: s10Q
section.heading: Reinstatement of unleased land after excavation made under an excavation permit

subsection.content: A permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit shall, before the expiry or termination of the permit, reinstate and make good the land as required by any condition of the permit.

subsection.leadIn: If any unleased land is not reinstated and made good in accordance with subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the expiry or termination of the permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as required by any condition of the permit,

subsection.continued: the Authority may carry out such work as he considers necessary to reinstate and make good the land, and any other land the reinstatement and making good of which is, in his opinion, necessary in consequence of the excavation, notwithstanding that the work for the carrying out of which the excavation was made have not been completed.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may recover from the permittee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cost of any work carried out by the Authority under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the cost of any work carried out by the Authority to reinstate and make good any unleased land if the necessity for such work—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: arises within 12 months after the completion of work for the reinstatement and making good of the land under this section; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is attributable to any fault on the part of such permittee or his servants or agents.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that any work carried out under subsection (2) shall not be regarded as an excavation for the purpose of this Ordinance.

section.name: s10R
section.heading: Reinstatement of unleased land after excavation made under a lease, licence, etc.

subsection.content: Any person who makes or maintains an excavation under and in accordance with a lease, licence, deed of appropriation, memorandum of appropriation or an engineering conditions for land allocation issued by the Director of Lands shall reinstate and make good the land as required by any condition of the lease, licence, deed of appropriation, memorandum of appropriation or engineering conditions for land allocation, as the case may be.

If any unleased land is not reinstated and made good in accordance with subsection (1), the Director of Lands may carry out such work as he considers necessary to reinstate and make good the land, and any other land the reinstatement and making good of which is, in his opinion, necessary in consequence of the excavation, notwithstanding that the works for the carrying out of which the excavation was made have not been completed.
The Director of Lands may recover from the person mentioned in subsection (1) the cost of any work carried out by the Director under subsection (2).
For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that any work carried out under subsection (2) shall not be regarded as excavation for the purpose of this Ordinance.

section.name: s10S
section.heading: Provision of safety facilities in connection with excavation
section.content: If any condition of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit requiring the provision of facilities for the safety or convenience of the public is contravened, the Authority may provide such facilities and recover the cost thereof from the permittee of the permit.

section.name: s10T
section.heading: Provision of safety precautions and support

subsection.leadIn: The permittee and nominated permittee of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adopt all necessary safety precautions to protect the public or any person making or maintaining an excavation to which the permit relates from any danger or injury;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide adequate support for the structural stability of buildings, roads, slopes, structures, pipes, lighting posts, utility services or similar installations adjacent to the excavation so as to prevent the public or any person from being endangered by a fall or displacement of earth, rock or other material.

subsection.content: Where there is a permittee and no nominated permittee and subsection (1) is contravened, the permittee shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000.

Where there is a permittee and a nominated permittee and subsection (1) is contravened, both the permittee and the nominated permittee shall each be guilty of an offence and shall each be liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000.

It is a defence in a proceeding against a person for an offence under subsection (2) or (3) if the person charged shows that he took all reasonable steps and exercised all due diligence to avoid committing the offence.

subsection.leadIn: A court may, in making a decision on the defence provided under subsection (4), take into consideration that a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) or (3) has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hired a competent person to supervise the excavation concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a documented system for supervising the excavation concerned, including but not limited to a system which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is managed by a competent person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: requires inspection of the excavation to ensure compliance with duties imposed under subsection (1) and record of such inspection;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a documented system to ensure his contractor complies with the duties imposed under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: taken other reasonable steps.

def.name: CompetentPerson
def.leadIn: For the purpose of subsection (5), competent person (合資格人士) means a person who is registered as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered architect under the Architects Registration Ordinance (Cap. 408);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered professional engineer under the Engineers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 409) and is within a discipline which is relevant to the excavation concerned or the works within that excavation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered professional surveyor under the Surveyors Registration Ordinance (Cap. 417) and is within a discipline which is relevant to the excavation concerned or the works within that excavation; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a safety officer under the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Safety Officers and Safety Supervisors) Regulations (Cap. 59 sub. leg. Z) and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where subsection (5)(a) is applicable, has at least 3 years’ experience in supervising excavation which is similar to the excavation concerned; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where subsection (5)(b)(i) is applicable, has at least 3 years’ experience in managing documented system which is similar to the system described in that subsection. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)

section.name: s10U
section.heading: Designation of strategic street, sensitive street and remaining street

subsection.leadIn: The Director of Highways may, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate any street or part of a street as a strategic street, a sensitive street or a remaining street after taking into consideration the economic costs of traffic delay in a carriageway caused or likely to be caused by an excavation carried out on the street; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend or revoke any such designation.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that a notice published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s10V
section.heading: Service of notice
section.leadIn: A notice (howsoever described) which under this Part is required to be, or may be, sent or served to or on a person (howsoever described) other than the Authority shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be so sent or served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to him;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at his last known address for service, or at his last known place of residence or business, in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to him at his last known address for service, or at his last known postal address, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other similar method to him at his last known address for service, or at his last known postal address, or at his last known place of residence or business, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: given to or served on a director or manager of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at the company’s last known address for service, or at its last known place of business, in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to the company at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other similar method to the company at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, or at its last known place of business, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person (attorney) holding a power of attorney under which the attorney is authorized to accept service in respect of another person on whom it is required to be so sent or served, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the attorney is an individual, delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the attorney is a company, given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the attorney is a partnership, delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: where the attorney is a partnership, given, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Summary Remedy for Breaches of Government Leases and Licences

section.name: s11
section.heading: Duty of lessee or licensee to notify Authority of unlawful structure

subsection.leadIn: If it comes to the knowledge of a lessee or licensee that, in breach of the Government lease or licence, a structure— (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is being erected or placed on the land or on any building on the land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been erected or placed thereon since 22 October 1965,

subsection.continued: otherwise than by him or on his behalf, the lessee or licensee shall notify the Authority within 48 hours.

subsection.content: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)

In proceedings for an offence under subsection (2), the lessee or licensee shall be presumed to have known that the structure was being or had been erected or placed on the land, unless he proves that he did not know, and could not reasonably have known, of the same.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a structure is being or has been erected or placed on leased land, or on land occupied under a licence, or on any building on such land, in breach of a Government lease or licence; or (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a structure on leased land or land occupied under a licence, being a structure which by virtue of a covenant, condition or stipulation in a Government lease or licence can be used only for agricultural purposes— (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is being used for any other purpose in breach of that covenant, condition or stipulation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the use for that other purpose is not authorized by any permission granted, or does not appear in any survey or record made, by the Authority before the date* on which the Crown Land (Amendment) Ordinance 1979 (56 of 1979) came into operation,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, by notice in writing served on the lessee or licensee, require him—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in a case to which paragraph (a) applies, to demolish the structure;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in a case to which paragraph (b) applies, to discontinue such use and, if the Authority thinks it appropriate, to restore the structure so that it may be used for agricultural purposes,

subsection.continued: before such date as may be specified in the notice. (Replaced 56 of 1979 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: If a lessee or licensee does not comply with a notice served on him under subsection (1), any public officer, or other person, acting on the direction of the Authority may, with the assistance of such other public officers or other persons as may be necessary, enter on the land and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case to which subsection (1)(a) applies, demolish the structure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case to which subsection (1)(b) applies, demolish the structure or, if the Authority thinks fit, carry out such works as may be necessary to restore the structure so that it may be used for agricultural purposes. (Amended 56 of 1979 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A lessee or licensee (for the purpose of complying with a notice under subsection (1)) and (for the purpose of subsection (2)) any authorized person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove from the structure any person or property therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take possession of such property and of any property resulting from the demolition of the structure.

subsection.content: Any property of which possession is taken under subsection (3)(b) by an authorized person shall become the property of the Government free from the rights of any person and, subject to subsection (5), may be dealt with as the Authority thinks fit. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may order that— (Amended 3 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the whole or a part of any property which has become the property of the Government under subsection (4); or (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the whole or a part of the value of any such property,

subsection.continued: shall be delivered or paid to any person who appears to him to have a moral claim thereto.

subsection.content: The Authority may recover from the lessee or licensee any cost incurred in or arising out of the demolition of a structure under subsection (2) and of the exercise of the powers conferred by subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) may be served by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivering it to the lessee or licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: posting it to him by registered post addressed to his last place of business or residence known to the Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: posting the notice in or on the land or structure to which the notice relates.

subsection.content: The powers conferred by this section are in addition to and not in derogation from the powers conferred on the Government by the Government Rights (Re-entry and Vesting Remedies) Ordinance (Cap. 126). (Added 56 of 1979 s. 5. Amended 29 of 1998 s. 14)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Power of entry and inspection

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertaining whether there has been a breach of a Government lease or licence for the purposes of section 12(1); or (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carrying out any work or interviewing any person prior to the clearance of any land or the demolition of any structure on leased land or land occupied under a licence in accordance with the powers conferred by this Ordinance,

section.continued: any public officer authorized in writing by the Authority may, on production of his authority, enter and inspect the land and any structure thereon at any reasonable time and may also carry out—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any interview or investigation;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: any screening, or affixing of numbers on structures, for the purpose of establishing eligibility of persons for public housing; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: any computation of compensation and allowances for any industrial, commercial or agricultural undertaking.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Vesting of private streets in the Government

subsection.content: If a Government lease, or an agreement for surrender relating to leased land, contains a provision that the lessee shall, when required, hand back any private street to the Government free of cost, the Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, declare the private street, or such part thereof as may be specified in the notice, to be a public street. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

The Authority shall, within 7 days after the publication of a notice under subsection (1), register a copy thereof in the Land Registry together with a plan showing the land declared by such notice to be a public street. (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Upon the registration under subsection (2) in the Land Registry of a copy of a notice published under subsection (1)— (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all rights and obligations of the lessee in, upon or over the private street, or the part of the private street specified in the notice, shall be extinguished; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the private street, or such part of the private street, shall vest in the Government free from the rights of any person in the same manner and to the same effect as if it had been surrendered to the Government. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

section.name: s15
section.heading: No action to lie in respect of extinguishment of rights in private street
section.text: No action shall be brought or continued, and no compensation shall be payable, in respect of the extinguishment under section 14(3) of the rights of any person in, upon or over the private street or such part of the private street.

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Power of approval by Chief Executive in Council in Government leases
section.text: Where any Government lease contains a condition to the effect that any matter or thing may not be done without the approval or consent of the Chief Executive in Council, the condition shall be deemed to include a provision that the power of the Chief Executive in Council to grant approval or give consent may be exercised by the Chief Executive.
section.sourceNote: (Added 72 of 1973 s. 2. Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105; 3 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Obstruction
section.content: Any person who obstructs an authorized person exercising any power, performing any duty, or carrying out any function, under this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s16A
section.heading: False statements
section.leadIn: Any person who makes a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in reply to any question put to him under or for the purposes of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any document required by, under or for the purposes of this Ordinance,

section.continued: which he knows to be false or misleading in a material particular shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s16B
section.heading: Evidence by certificate
section.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, a certificate having attached thereto a map relating to any land in respect of which the offence is alleged to have been committed and purporting to be signed by an Estate Surveyor and certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the land as shown on the map is unleased land; and (Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no licence, deed or memorandum of appropriation has been granted authorizing erection of a structure on the land; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no removal permit has been granted authorizing the extraction and removal of earth, turf or stone from the land; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: no excavation licence has been granted authorizing the making or maintaining of any excavation in the land,

section.continued: shall be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof and—

paragraph.name: A
paragraph.content: until the contrary is proved it shall be presumed that the certificate was signed by an Estate Surveyor; and

paragraph.name: B
paragraph.content: the certificate and the map attached thereto shall be prima facie evidence of the facts contained therein.

section.name: s16C
section.heading: Certificate of record of information produced from Authority’s computer systems

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court or magistrate, a document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a copy of a record of any information produced from any of the computer systems of the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be certified by the Authority as being such a copy,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof.

subsection.leadIn: Where a document is admitted in evidence under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the court or magistrate before which it is produced shall, until the contrary is proved, presume that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the document is a true copy of the record of information referred to in subsection (1)(a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it was properly certified by the Authority for the purposes of subsection (1)(b); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the record was duly made at the time (if any) referred to in the document as that at which it was made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the document is prima facie evidence of the contents of the information referred to in subsection (1)(a).

subsection.content: Where a document is admitted in evidence under subsection (1), the court or magistrate before which or whom it is produced may, if it or he thinks fit, on its or his own motion or on the application of any party to the proceedings in question, summon the person who purports to have certified the document for the purpose of subsection (1)(b) and examine him as to its subject matter.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Use of force
section.text: An authorized person may use such force as may be necessary for the exercise of any power, the performance of any duty, or the carrying out of any function, under this Ordinance.

section.name: s18
section.heading: No claim to lie against Government, Authority or Secretary for Development

subsection.content: Neither the Government nor the Authority shall be liable for any loss or damage suffered by any person in consequence of anything done under section 6, 10, 10A, 10B, 10C, 10D, 10E, 10F, 10J, 10K, 10L, 10M, 10O, 10P, 10Q, 10R, 10S, 10U, 12 or 18C by the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2003 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Neither the Government nor the Secretary for Development shall be liable for any loss or damage suffered by any person in consequence of anything done under section 10N, 10O or 10P. (Added 17 of 2003 s. 6. Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.def: In this section, Authority (當局) includes any authorized person.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Delegation
section.text: An Authority under this Ordinance may delegate any of its powers and functions to any public officer or class of public officer.

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by a decision of the Review Board made in respect of him under section 10M(13) relating to an assessment made under section 10M(1)(d), (g), (h) or (i) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board.
An appeal made under subsection (1) shall be made within 28 days from the date of service of a notice of the decision on the aggrieved person.
Any prescribed fee determined to be refunded to an aggrieved person pursuant to a decision of the Administrative Appeals Board shall be paid by the Director of Highways and without interest.

section.name: s18C
section.heading: Authority’s power to specify time limit and newly constructed street

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the time limit for the submission of an application for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the issue of an excavation permit or emergency excavation permit in relation to an excavation or any class of excavation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the extension of the period for which an excavation permit is valid in relation to an excavation or any class of excavation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a street or any class of streets as a newly constructed street or a class of newly constructed streets and the duration for which and the extent to which such street or such class of streets, as the case may be, shall not be used for any excavation.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that a notice published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for all or any of the following purposes— (Amended 3 of 2000 s. 3; 17 of 2003 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing anything which is to be or may be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for applications for licences or copies of licences;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fixing fees for the issue of copies of licences;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: empowering any public officer to determine whether land occupied or to be occupied under a licence is being or will be occupied for non-profit making, charitable or welfare purposes;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: generally, for the better carrying out of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any fees prescribed by regulations made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: be fixed at a level which provides for the recovery of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government in relation generally to the administration, regulation and control of matters to which this Ordinance relates; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: economic costs of traffic delay in a carriageway caused or likely to be caused by excavations on streets;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the payment of different fees in respect of matters or cases or streets of different classes or descriptions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the payment of fees to be calculated in any manner specified in the regulations. (Added 17 of 2003 s. 8)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Saving
section.text: Nothing in this Ordinance shall affect the rights or powers of the Government or any public officer under any other law.
